Title: Superficial cervical fascia
Content: The superficial cervical fascia is a thin layer of subcutaneous connective tissue that lies between the dermis of the skin and the deep cervical fascia It contains the platysma cutaneous nerves from the cervical plexus blood vessels and lymphatic vessels It also contains a varying amount of fat which is its distinguishing characteristic It is considered by some to be a part of the panniculus adiposus and not true fascia
